content.body: Domenic: ensuring the map has the correct thing for element-references requires duplicating most of reflect for element-references, no?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: ensuring the map has the correct thing for element-references requires duplicating most of reflect for element-references, no?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Domenic: ensuring the map has the correct thing for element-references requires duplicating most of reflect for element-references, no?
Domenic: ensuring the map has the correct thing for element-references requires duplicating most of reflect for element-references, no?

content.body: It's not just a single concept after all
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It's not just a single concept after all

content.body: Also, I think that we should try to update the ARIA attributes that only allow a couple strings to be enumerated attributes (this indeed doesn't address the problem with how invalid values map to AT, but it might help with it, pending further updates to accname)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Also, I think that we should try to update the ARIA attributes that only allow a couple strings to be enumerated attributes (this indeed doesn't address the problem with how invalid values map to AT, but it might help with it, pending further updates to accname)

content.body: Domenic: overall it seems somewhat reasonable to attempt to stick the element-references in the map directly, but I think we still need most of my setup if we actually want to improve ARIA attributes overall (which WebKit wants to try at least)
content.formatted_body: Domenic: overall it seems somewhat reasonable to attempt to stick the element-references in the map directly, but I think we still need most of my setup if we actually want to improve ARIA attributes overall (which WebKit wants to try at least)

Domenic: overall it seems somewhat reasonable to attempt to stick the element-references in the map directly, but I think we still need most of my setup if we actually want to improve ARIA attributes overall (which WebKit wants to try at least)

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> Domenic: ensuring the map has the correct thing for element-references requires duplicating most of reflect for element-references, no?

I don't think it does, because the complexity of reflect is the interaction of strings and element references. For ElementInternals it's literally just an element reference (or FrozenArray of them)

content.body: Agreed it would be nice if ARIA attributes were enumerated.

content.body: Domenic: why do we not need the difference between explicitly set attr-element and attr-associated element for ElementInternals?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: why do we not need the difference between explicitly set attr-element and attr-associated element for ElementInternals?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Domenic: why do we not need the difference between explicitly set attr-element and attr-associated element for ElementInternals?
Domenic: why do we not need the difference between explicitly set attr-element and attr-associated element for ElementInternals?

content.body: attr-associated = explicitly set + whatever's going on with the string-valued content attribute
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: attr-associated = explicitly set + whatever's going on with the string-valued content attribute

content.body: There is no string-valued content attribute for ElementInternals
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: There is no string-valued content attribute for ElementInternals
